In a statement issued by the Tony Blair 's office, Mr David Cameron said: I am very sorry that Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my Director of Communications, although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so. Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the Government `` During his time working for me, Andy Coulson has carried out his role with complete professionalism. He has been a brilliant member of my team and has thrown himself at the job with skill and dedication

He says Paul Bremer 's decisions inadvertently stoked nationalist resentments and fanned the embers of what would become the Iraqi insurgency . Donald Rumsfeld had favoured going into Iraq quickly and getting out quickly, handing over power to the Iraqis, but Paul Bremer favoured a slower approach. lengthy legal battle with European Union regulators investigating its market dominance, the Sunday Telegraph quoted its chief executive as saying.`` We certainly want to avoid that,'' Eric Schmidt told the paper in an interview. I think it is in our interests and I would hope in their interests to a do a quick analysis of concerns that have been raised by competitors, hopefully they are minor or they are not correct.`` We'll find out and make sure we are operating well within the law and the spirit of the law. Brussels launched a formal investigation into Google Inc. in November following complaints from European rivals that it was abusing its dominant position in the market for web search services.
